passages.text: >35 Reasons to Attend AI Week!

Our AI Summit has expanded into an AI Week, running Sept. 22- 26, 2025, with Fri, Sept. 26, dedicated to spotlight private leaders in Cyber. Please join us virtually for five days of deep- dive conversations featuring \(35+\) industry leaders, exploring AI's impact, opportunities, and adoption across verticals and layers the software stack. This summit will spotlight the innovations and transformative trends shaping the future of software. Register Here

We're thrilled to announce major additions to our speaker roster, including Parker Harris, Co- Founder & CTO of Salesforce (CRM); Arvind Jain, CEO & Founder of Glean and Co- Founder of Rubrik; Hamza Fodderwala, SVP of Investor Relations & Strategic Finance at Palo Alto Networks (PANW); and Evan Reiser, CEO & Co- Founder of Abnormal AI, along with many other industry leaders.
Brent Thill, Jefferies Senior Analyst - Software, Internet & AI
Joe Gallo, Jefferies Analyst - Cybersecurity & Software
Maximilian Joseph, Jefferies Senior Associate - Software, Internet & AI
Preliminary Agenda Below - Fireside Times To Follow

AI Week Preliminary AgendaMonday, September 22ndCompaniesSpeakerCoveo (CVO)Laurent Simoneau, CEO &amp; FounderWriterKevin Chung (CSO)SynthesisSteffen Tjerrild, COO &amp; Co-FounderGleanArvind Jain, CEO &amp; FounderAnacondaPeter Wang, Chief AI &amp; Innovation Officer &amp; Co-FounderResemble AIZohair Ahmed, CEO &amp; FounderTredenceShub Bhowmick, CEO &amp; Co-FounderRoper (ROP)Neil Hunn, CEORead AIDavid Shim, CEO &amp; Co-FounderPalo Alto Networks (PANW)Hamza Fodderwala, SVP IR &amp; Strategic FinanceTuesday, September 23rdCompaniesSpeakerExpertConor Jensen, Global CDO @ DataikuReka AIDani Yogatama, CEO &amp; FounderEzraAI LabsOphir Samson, CEO &amp; FounderContextual AIDouwe Kiela, CEO &amp; Co-FounderAiseraAbhi Maheshwari (CEO) &amp; Ben Lu (CFO)Trunk ToolsDr. Sarah Buchner, CEO &amp; FounderExpertBill MacCartney, Fellow at AI Fund, CTO In Residence at SignalFireWednesday, September 24thCompaniesSpeakerBlend 360Oz Dogan, President AmericasSalesforce (CRM)Parker Harris, Co-Founder &amp; CTOTuringJonathan Siddarth, CEO &amp; Co-FounderLuma AIAmit Jain, CEO &amp; Co-FounderCampfireJohn Glasgow, CEO &amp; Co-FounderAvenue ZWhitney Hart, CSOThursday, September 25thCompaniesSpeakerTwine SecurityBenny Porat, CEO &amp; Co-FounderLightricksZeev Farbman, CEO &amp; Co-FounderQlikMike Capone, CEOActiveFenceNoam Schwartz, CEO &amp; Co-FounderDecagonJesse Zhang, CEO &amp; Co-FounderRilletNicolas Kopp, CEO &amp; FounderAI21 LabsYoav Shoham Co-Founder &amp; Co-CEODialpadBrian Peterson, CTO &amp; Co-FounderClickUpZeb Evans, CEO &amp; Co-FounderFriday, September 26thCompaniesSpeakerHidden LayerChristopher Sestito, CEO &amp; Co-FounderAbnormal AIEvan Reiser, CEO &amp; Co-FounderHarmonic SecurityAlastair Paterson, CEO &amp; Co-Founder
Speaker: Parker Harris, Co- Founder & CTO

Salesforce is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM), offering a unified platform that empowers companies to connect with their customers through data, automation, and artificial intelligence. Its core product suite, Customer 360, integrates sales, service, marketing, commerce, and analytics, enabling organizations to deliver personalized experiences at scale. Innovations like Agentforce and Einstein AI position Salesforce at the forefront of autonomous CRM, helping businesses automate workflows and make smarter decisions. The company serves a diverse range of industries, from financial services to healthcare
Speaker: Neil Hunn, CEO

Roper is a highly diversified software company consisting of nearly 30 mission critical, niche assets that collectively demonstrate a track record of compounding free cash flow generation. Roper's strategy is acquiring high- margin, niche business leaders and reinvesting their cash flow to acquire more businesses with similar characteristics, all supported by \(\) 5B\$ in M&A firepower. This unique approach has solidified Roper's position as a premier cash flow compounder with an organic growth reacel on the way and \(40\%\) adjusted EBITDA margins.
Speaker: Hamza Fodderwala, SVP, IR & Strategic Finance

Palo Alto Networks is an American multinational cybersecurity company that was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Santa Clara, California. The company offers advanced next- generation firewalls and a suite of security products to protect organizations across on- premises and cloud environments. Palo Alto Networks serves over 75,000 customers in more than 180 countries, including the majority of the Fortune 100, reflecting its global leadership in the industry.
Speaker: Arvind Jain, CEO & Founder

Glean is an AI- powered enterprise work assistant platform that helps organizations search, discover, and generate knowledge across all internal tools and data sources. Founded in 2019 by former Google engineers, Glean integrates enterprise search, generative AI, and workflow automation to improve workplace efficiency and enable employees to build no- code and low- code AI apps. The company serves hundreds of enterprise customers, including Databricks, Duolingo, and Fortune 500 firms, and surpassed \(\) 100\$ million in annual recurring revenue. Glean has raised \(\) 765\$ million in funding, most recently a \(\) 150\$ M Series F in June 2025, and is now valued at \(\) 7.2\$ billion, making it one of the fastest- growing enterprise AI startups.
Speaker: Jesse Zhang, CEO & Co- Founder

Decagon, founded in 2023, builds advanced conversational AI agents to automate complex customer experience workflows across channels and languages. Co- founded by Jesse Zhang and Ashwin Sreenivas, Decagon's agents act as "10x employees," enabling brands like Duolingo, Hertz, and Notion to scale support efficiently. Decagon's AI agents provide human- like responses across multiple communication channels, including chat, email, and voice. The platform uses Agent Operating Procedures (AOPs), which combine natural language instructions with underlying code, allowing
enterprises to customize and scale their AI agents. The company is backed by Andreessen Horowitz and Accel.
Speaker: Steffen Tjerrild, COO & Co- Founder

Synthesis is a leading AI- powered video generation platform that enables businesses to create professional videos using lifelike avatars without cameras or actors. The company serves over 65,000 customers worldwide, including more than \(70\%\) of Fortune 100 companies, across industries like corporate training, marketing, and internal communications. Synthesis has raised over \(330 million in funding from top investors such as NEA, Accel, NVentures, GV, and Adobe, reaching a\) 2.1 billion valuation in 2025. Its revenue has grown rapidly, hitting \$100 million in 2025, driven by a SaaS model with strong enterprise adoption and global market penetration
Speaker: Mike Capone (CEO)

Qlik Technologies is a global leader in data integration, data quality, and analytics, empowering organizations to transform complex data landscapes into actionable insights. Its platform- agnostic solutions unify data across cloud, multi- cloud, and on- premises environments, enabling enterprises to make trusted, data- driven decisions at scale. With offerings like Qlik Talend Cloud and Qlik Answers, the company delivers explainable AI, real- time analytics, and automated machine learning to drive competitive advantage across industries including healthcare, financial services, retail, and the public sector. Qlik's end- to- end capabilities—from data ingestion and governance to predictive analytics—support enterprise agility and innovation in the AI era. In 2016, Qlik was taken private by Thoma Bravo, marking a strategic shift toward accelerated growth through acquisitions and R&D investment.
Speaker: Amit Jain, CEO & Co- Founder

Luma AI was founded in 2021 to build this next generation of intelligence that can partner with humans to help us do extraordinary things, pursuing visual intelligence through multi- modal foundation models. Luma's models were used in the creation of the viral AI Coca- Cola ads. Dream Machine, which launched in June 2024 and has reached more than 25M registered users, is built on Luma AI's text- to- video and text- to- image visual AI model. This new free and subscription based service allows everyone to make high- quality, realistic, and creative videos and images. Dream Machine was built by a radically talented and very small team of researchers, engineers, and designers. Additionally, Luma AI and Amazon Web Services (AWS) announced a strategic collaboration that will brings Luma AI's best- in- class visual AI models to Amazon Bedrock, enabling AWS customers to build and deploy visual capabilities into their AI applications. Luma AI has raised \$80M in funding from strategic investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Amplify Partners, Matrix Partners, General Catalyst, and South Park Commons.
Speaker: Jonathan Siddarth, CEO & Co- Founder

Turing began as a remote engineering talent platform and has evolved into a key player in AI infrastructure and coding services. With \$247M raised and a \$2.2B valuation, Turing supports AGI development and LLM applications for clients like OpenAI. Turing's proprietary platform, ALAN, orchestrates its operations by matching companies with over 4 million AI- vetted developers and STEM experts, while also generating specialized datasets to improve model performance. The company
played a pivotal role in training data for models like GPT- 4, helping OpenAI and others enhance reasoning and agentic capabilities.
Speaker: John Glasgow, CEO & Co- Founder

Campfire is an AI- native enterprise resource planning (ERP) platform designed to modernize finance operations for fast- growing companies. Founded to eliminate the pain of legacy ERPs, Campfire helps finance teams automate workflows, accelerate month- end close, and unlock deeper financial insights through AI- driven tools like its conversational interface, Ember AI. The company recently raised a \(35 million Series A led by Accel, with participation from Y Combinator, Foundation Capital, and prominent industry executives. Campfire has seen 10x revenue growth in the past year and serves innovative customers such as Replit, Coder, Solv, Trust & Will, Flex, Advisor360, and Midi Health, positioning itself as a next- generation alternative to NetSuite and SAP
Speaker: Yoav Shoham Co- Founder & Co- CEO

AI21 Labs is a Tel Aviv- based AI company founded in 2017, specializing in large language models and natural language processing tools that power advanced reading and writing assistants. Its flagship products, including Wordtune and AI21 Studio, help businesses and individuals generate, understand, and optimize text at scale. The company has raised \(637 million across multiple rounds, including a\) 300M Series D in May 2025, reaching a \(1.4 billion valuation. AI21 Labs counts major investors such as Google, Nvidia, Pitango, and Coatue, and reported\) 57.8M in revenue in 2024, with continued strong growth driven by enterprise adoption and generative AI demand.
Speaker: Dani Yogatama, CEO & Founder

Reka AI is a Sunnyvale- based AI startup founded in 2022 by Dani Yogatama, alongside co- founders with backgrounds at DeepMind, Google, Meta, and Baidu. The company specializes in building efficient, multimodal foundation models capable of processing text, images, audio, and video across 32 languages and up to 128,000- token context windows. Its flagship models—Reka Core, Flash, and Edge—are designed for enterprise- grade performance, balancing speed, accuracy, and resource efficiency. Reka recently raised \(110 million in funding from NVIDIA and Snowflake, tripling its valuation to over\) 1 billion. With a focus on privacy, adaptability, and real- world deployment, Reka is rapidly emerging as a leading independent alternative to Big Tech in the generative AI space.
Speaker: Zohaib Ahmed, CEO & Founder

Resemble AI specializes in generative voice technology, offering tools for voice cloning, localization, and real- time speech transformation. Headquartered in Mountain View, the company serves industries like gaming and media, with advanced features for deepfake detection and IP protection. It has raised over \(12M and is led by co- founders Zohaib Ahmed and Saqib Muhammad.
Speaker: Peter Wang, Chief AI & Innovation Officer & Co- Founder

Anaconda, founded in 2012, is a leading open- source software company focused on Python- based data science and AI. Serving over 50 million users - including 95% of the Fortune 500- Anaconda simplifies package management and deployment through its flagship distribution and
Conda environment manager. In 2025, it launched a unified AI platform for open source innovation. The company operates profitably with over \(150M in annual recurring revenue (ARR) as of July 2025.\)
Speaker: Zeev Farbman, CEO & Co-Founder

Lightricks is a global leader in AI- powered creative tools, empowering creators and businesses through award- winning apps like Facetune and Videoleap. The company is expanding into enterprise solutions across advertising, entertainment, and e- commerce. Its innovations include LTX Studio for visual storytelling and LTXV, an open- source video model democratizing advanced AI capabilities. Backed by investors such as Goldman Sachs, Insight Partners, and Greycroft, Lightricks is shaping the future of content creation.
Speaker: Dr. Sarah Buchner, CEO & Founder

Trunk Tools is transforming the construction industry by converting unstructured jobsite data into actionable insights using intelligent agents. Founded by Dr. Sarah Buchner, the company emphasizes Intelligence Augmentation (IA) to empower workers rather than replace them. With \(70M raised- including a\) 40M Series B led by Insight Partners- Trunk Tools is deployed across hundreds of projects, automating workflows and enhancing safety and efficiency.
Speaker: Abhi Maheshwari (CEO), Ben Lu (CFO)

Aisera is a leading provider of agentic AI solutions for Fortune 1000 enterprises, specializing in employee experience (EX) and customer service (CS) use cases. Recognized as a Leader in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for AI Applications in ITSM, Aisera delivers an AI- native architecture built on years of domain expertise, workflows, and system integrations. Its platform achieves workflow resolution rates up to \(90\%\) , driving measurable economic value. Independent benchmarks with Stanford have demonstrated superior accuracy and performance at one- tenth the cost of general- purpose foundational models
Speaker: Kevin Chung (CSO)

Writer is a generative AI company delivering enterprise- grade solutions for content generation, workflow automation, and agentic AI. Its proprietary Palmyra models support industry- specific applications in healthcare, finance, and legal. Writer serves over 300 enterprise customers such as Uber, Spotify, and Salesforce, driving up to \(9x\) ROI.
Speaker: Douwe Kiela, CEO & Co- Founder

Contextual AI offers production- ready enterprise AI solutions from the pioneers of Retrieval- Augmented Generation (RAG). The platform enables businesses to build and deploy highly accurate, auditable, and specialized RAG agents that go beyond demos and into real- world production environments.
Speaker: Shub Bhowmick, CEO & Co- Founder

Tredence is a global data science and AI solutions provider specializing in bridging the gap between insight creation and value realization—often referred to as the "last mile" in AI. The company delivers

vertical- specific solutions across industries such as retail, CPG, telecom, healthcare, and financial services, using a combination of domain expertise, proprietary accelerators, and advanced analytics. Its platform, ATOM.AI, enables enterprises to rapidly deploy GenAI- powered workflows, predictive models, and decision intelligence across the value chain.
Speaker: Oz Dogan, President Americas

Blend360 is a global data science and AI solutions company founded in 2015, headquartered in Columbia, Maryland. The company specializes in blending data, technology, AI, and people to deliver high- impact solutions for enterprise clients. Its core capabilities include Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Governance, Data Science, and MLOps, helping organizations unlock the full potential of analytics and AI. With 1,000+ employees, Blend360 has been recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies for five consecutive years, achieving a 55% CAGR since inception. The company serves Fortune 500 clients, with 75% of its revenue coming from this segment, and maintains a 77% World- Class NPS score. Blend360's mission is to co- create meaningful impact by empowering clients to stand out through innovative, data- driven strategies.
Speaker: Noam Schwartz, CEO & Co- Founder

ActiveFence is an AI- powered trust and safety platform that helps technology companies and governments detect, analyze, and prevent harmful online content and malicious activity at scale. Founded in 2018 and headquartered in Tel Aviv, the company provides solutions for content moderation, fraud prevention, disinformation detection, and public safety, leveraging advanced AI and human expertise. ActiveFence protects billions of users globally and counts some of the world's largest tech platforms among its customers. The company has raised about \(\) 100\$ million in funding, including a Series B round led by CRV and Highland Europe, and has grown through strategic acquisitions like Spectrum Labs. With a valuation of \(\) 500\$ million, ActiveFence is recognized as a leader in AI- driven threat intelligence and online harm prevention.
Speaker: Christopher Sestito, CEO & Co- Founder

HiddenLayer is an AI application security company that protects machine learning models and AI systems from adversarial attacks, model theft, and data poisoning. Founded in 2022 and headquartered in Austin, Texas, HiddenLayer offers a Machine Learning Security (MLSec) platform which uses advanced detection and monitoring to secure AI assets without requiring access to sensitive training data. The company serves Fortune 100 enterprises across finance, defense, and tech sectors, helping them adopt AI securely at scale. HiddenLayer has raised \(\) 56\$ million in funding, including a \(\) 50\$ million Series A round in 2023 led by M12 (Microsoft's venture arm) and Moore Strategic Ventures. Recognized as a leader in AI security, HiddenLayer has earned accolades such as "Most Innovative Startup" at RSAC (RSA Conference) and is rapidly expanding its global footprint.
Speaker: Benny Porat, CEO & Co- Founder

Twine Security is a cybersecurity startup founded in 2024 with offices in Tel Aviv and Seattle. Twine aims to create AI- driven "digital employees" that automate key security tasks. Focused initially on identity and access management (IAM), Twine's generative AI platform (nicknamed "Alex") can take on end- to- end identity processes, from investigating account ownership to autonomously conducting user access reviews, helping overstretched security teams close the talent gap. Twine has raised \(\) 12\$ million in seed funding co- led by Ten Eleven Ventures and Dell Technologies Capital, with notable
participation from the co- founders of Wiz. Positioned as an emerging innovator in cybersecurity automation, Twine was selected as a finalist in Black Hat USA 2025's Startup Spotlight competition.
Speaker: Evan Reiser, CEO & Co- Founder

Abnormal AI is a cybersecurity company that delivers AI- native protection against advanced threats across email, collaboration tools, and cloud applications. Its behavioral AI platform analyzes identity, relationships, and business processes to detect and block socially engineered attacks such as phishing, business email compromise (BEC), and account takeover. Founded in 2018, Abnormal has grown to serve over 3,200 customers worldwide, including \(20\%\) of the Fortune 500. In August 2024, the company raised \(250 million in a Series p funding round led by Wellington Management, which valued Abnormal at\) 5.1 billion.
Speaker: Zeb Evans, CEO & Co- Founder

ClickUp is an all- in- one productivity platform that combines task management, docs, goals, and automation to help teams streamline work and boost efficiency. Founded in 2016 by Zeb Evans, ClickUp has grown to serve over more than 10 million users globally, competing with \(80\%\) of F500 using its tools. The company has raised \(535 million in funding, including a\) 400M Series C led by Andreessen Horowitz and Tiger Global, and is valued at \$4 billion.
Speaker: Laurent Simoneau, CEO & Founder

Coveo Solutions Inc. is a Canadian AI- powered software company specializing in enterprise search, personalization, and generative experiences for digital commerce, customer service, and workplace applications. Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Quebec City, Coveo serves global brands with its composable AI platform, processing over 25 billion events monthly to deliver individualized and trusted digital experiences. Publicly traded on the TSX under the symbol CVO, Coveo has raised significant funding and continues to expand its capabilities through strategic acquisitions and innovation.
Speaker: Ophir Samson, CEO & Founder

Ezra AI Labs is an AI- powered interview platform that helps candidates showcase their skills on their own schedule while giving companies a fair, efficient way to evaluate talent. Using natural- sounding and low- latency voice AI to create comfortable, engaging conversations that bring out candidates' best qualities and match them with the right opportunities. Ezra provides free career tools for job seekers, including mock interviews, resume improvement, and professional coaching, all designed to help you land your dream role.
Speaker: Alastair Paterson, CEO & Co- Founder

Harmonic Security is a cybersecurity company founded in 2023 that leverages generative AI to deliver zero- touch data protection for enterprises. Its platform uses pre- trained language models to detect sensitive data in real time, providing security teams with automated controls, visibility into AI usage, and user- friendly nudges, which eliminate the need for complex labeling or rule- based systems. The company has raised \$26 million in funding, including a \$17.5M Series A led by Next47, with participation from Ten Eleven Ventures, Bain Capital, and others. Harmonic already serves enterprise
customers in double digits and is recognized as a disruptor in data protection for the GenAI era, enabling organizations to adopt AI securely and at scale.
Speaker: Whitney Hart (CSO)

Avenue Z is a media and technology firm redefining digital influence through AI Optimization (AIO), a modern evolution of SEO tailored for the AI- driven search landscape. Under the strategic leadership of Whitney Hart, a recognized innovator in blockchain and AI, Avenue Z helps brands architect digital authority and drive revenue across all channels. Hart's background includes leading initiatives at Feral File and Trilitech, and advising Fortune 500 companies and governments on emerging technologies. Avenue Z's proprietary frameworks position it at the forefront of AI- powered marketing, public relations, and content strategy, enabling clients to dominate in algorithm- driven environments.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) \ \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(\) 10\(, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus\) 20\% \(or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Risks which may impede the achievement of our Price Target

This report was prepared for general circulation and does not provide investment recommendations specific to individual investors. As such, the financial instruments discussed in this report may not be suitable for all investors and investors must make their own investment decisions based upon their specific investment objectives and financial situation utilizing their own financial advisors as they deem necessary. Past performance of the financial instruments recommended in this report should not be taken as an indication or guarantee of future results. The price, value of, and income from, any of the financial instruments mentioned in this report can rise as well as fall and may be affected by changes in economic, financial and political factors. If a financial instrument is denominated in a currency other than the investor's home currency, a change in exchange rates may adversely affect the price of, value of, or income derived from the financial instrument described in this report. To the extent prices are shown in non-US currency, please note that our local currency price targets are based on a currency conversion using an exchange rate as of the prior trading day (unless otherwise noted). Should there be fluctuations in the exchange rate after this date, that will affect the non-US target prices and should no longer be relied upon. In addition, investors in securities such as ADRs, whose values are affected by the currency of the underlying security, effectively assume currency risk.

JRS does not create tailored or personalized research and all research provided by JRS is impersonal. If you are paying separately for this research, it is being provided to you by JRS. Transactions by or on behalf of any US person may only be effected through Jefferies LLC. Jefferies LLC, JIL, Jefferies GmbH and their affiliates, may make a market or provide liquidity in the financial instruments referred to in this report; and where they do make a market, such activity is disclosed specifically in this report under "company specific disclosures".

For Canadian investors, this material is intended for use only by professional or institutional investors.
